content.raw:
This looks good to me. In the past we had done something like using a member variable to keep track of a particular visual’s visibility since ogre doesn’t support it. But I don’t think we need to worry about that for now.

pipelines and jenkins builds are failing. This branch probably needs to be merged with default.

Support for optix is currently on hold. I think you could just add a `SetVisible` function in `BaseVisual` class and print out an error like [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/src/09d6735be4d543452ba0d2e007b6782f775d0beb/include/ignition/rendering/base/BaseCamera.hh#lines-428) to let the user know that it’s not supported yet.

‌
content.html:
This looks good to me. In the past we had done something like using a member variable to keep track of a particular visual’s visibility since ogre doesn’t support it. But I don’t think we need to worry about that for now.

pipelines and jenkins builds are failing. This branch probably needs to be merged with default.

Support for optix is currently on hold. I think you could just add a SetVisible function in BaseVisual class and print out an error like here to let the user know that it’s not supported yet.

‌

content.raw:
thanks, wasn’t sure if conceptually this will ever have an equivalent in Optix, but I’ve added it to BaseVisual as requested in [0403ca4](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/commits/0403ca4ea41f6eda5863b03a83c559ea2730cc20?at=default)

FWIU, keeping track of a visual’s visibility with a variable wouldn’t be trivial since a Visual might be set to invisible as a side effect of its parent being set to invisible, so I support leaving potential implementation of that out of this PR

I was avoiding merging with default during my hand-testing so as not to pull in [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/issues/25/](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/issues/25/) but have merged now which hopefully will address the pipeline failure
